most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus

common_issues.title: Pieces OS startup failures on Windows
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch on Windows due to database corruption, invalid port errors, or authentication issues after updates. Suggested solutions include checking log files, verifying dependencies, and troubleshooting network connectivity. Pieces team is actively investigating and providing support.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on their Windows PC.
* User provided additional details about the problem.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to launch Pieces Desktop.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces Support Bot flagged the issue and assigned it to the appropriate team member.
* Pieces Support Bot provided links to potentially helpful resources:
    * Existing Issues on GitHub
    * Documentation
    * YouTube channel
* No solutions were proposed or implemented yet, as the issue is being looked into by the Pieces team.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The Pieces support team is investigating the issue.
* The user will receive a follow-up within 24 hours.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces Desktop Crashing

**Issue:** Pieces Desktop crashes on Windows.

**Key Points:**

* User reported crashes without providing specific details.
* Support bot suggested related issues and resources.
* Pieces representative requested log files, hardware details, and Windows build number.
* User provided log files and build number.
* Pieces representative requested a video call for further troubleshooting.
* Another user reported the same issue.
* Pieces representative offered a scheduled video call to assist the second user.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unclear cause of the crash.
* Difficulty reproducing the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing log files.
* Gathering hardware and system information.
* Scheduling video call for troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Investigation ongoing.
* Second user scheduled for troubleshooting assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be affecting multiple users.
* Pieces is actively investigating and supporting users to resolve the crashes.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Authentication Issues After Update

**Key Points:**

* @waseem852 created the issue, experiencing authentication problems after a Pieces OS update on Windows 11.
* @AlexanderSLoburev reported the same issue after an update to version 11.3.0, experiencing infinite loading on the authentication page.

**Problems Identified:**

* Users are unable to link their Google accounts after the update.
* The authentication page is stuck in an infinite loading loop.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Related issues were suggested for reference.
*  No explicit solutions were proposed or implemented within the provided conversation segment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved. Users are still experiencing authentication challenges.
* No further updates or information is provided in the conversation snippet.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation only includes the initial issue report and acknowledgement from the Pieces support bot.
* No response or updates from the Pieces team are included in the provided excerpt.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces OS on Windows due to antivirus software flagging, database corruption, and dependency connection problems. Solutions include adding Pieces OS to antivirus allow lists, downloading from the Microsoft Store, and reinstalling the application. Pieces team is actively investigating and providing support to resolve these issues.

related_issues.title: Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
related_issues.text:
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS_11.2.2.0_x64

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/160ed12d-f0a1-46be-bf36-05502353405e)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Anti-virus Flagging Pieces OS

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing their antivirus software (Kaspersky, NOD32, ESET) blocking Pieces OS installation or updates.
* The app is being flagged as a false positive by antivirus software.
* This issue is preventing users from using the app.

**Problems:**

* Antivirus software is blocking Pieces OS due to false positives.
* This is causing user frustration and preventing them from using the app.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Download Pieces OS from the Microsoft Store, where it has been validated as safe.
* Add the executable to the antivirus software's allow list.
* Allow users to choose where user-generated data is stored.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The Pieces team is actively working on preventing the app from being flagged as malicious by antivirus software.
* In the meantime, users can download the app from the Microsoft Store or add the executable to their allow list.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue is not a bug, but rather a compatibility issue with certain antivirus software.
* The Pieces team is working on a solution that will allow users to choose where their data is stored, which should help mitigate this issue.

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on their Windows PC.
* User provided additional details about the problem.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to launch Pieces Desktop.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces Support Bot flagged the issue and assigned it to the appropriate team member.
* Pieces Support Bot provided links to potentially helpful resources:
    * Existing Issues on GitHub
    * Documentation
    * YouTube channel
* No solutions were proposed or implemented yet, as the issue is being looked into by the Pieces team.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The Pieces support team is investigating the issue.
* The user will receive a follow-up within 24 hours.

recommendations: Investigate the recurring 'Pieces OS startup failures on Windows' issue, focusing on database corruption, invalid port errors, and authentication issues after updates.
Develop troubleshooting guides or FAQs addressing common startup issues, including database checks, dependency verification, and network connectivity.
Collaborate with security software vendors like Kaspersky to address false positive detections of Pieces OS.
Explore options for improving error messaging and logging related to database interactions and port configurations.
Consider implementing a more robust authentication recovery mechanism to assist users experiencing login issues after updates.
